plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: A popular evergreen shrub known for its large, glossy leaves and stunning rose-like flowers. It blooms in late autumn to early spring, bringing color during cooler months.
plants.location: East Asia, cultivated worldwide in temperate climates
plants.funFact: The Japanese Camellia has been cultivated for centuries and its oil is used for hair care in Japan.

plants.name: Erica arborea
plants.description: A woody shrub or small tree native to the Mediterranean region with white to pale pink bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late autumn and winter, often covering landscapes in bloom during this time.
plants.funFact: Tree Heath is an important nectar source for bees during late-season months when few other flowers are available.

plants.name: Magnolia grandiflora
plants.description: An evergreen tree notable for its large, fragrant white flowers that can bloom sporadically from spring through late autumn, often still showing blooms in November in warmer climates.
plants.funFact: The Southern Magnoliaâ€™s blooms are highly fragrant and have been used in traditional medicines.

plants.name: Leucadendron rubrum
plants.description: A striking shrub from South Africaâ€™s fynbos region with colorful bracts that appear in late autumn, adding splashes of red and yellow to the landscape.
plants.funFact: Leucadendrons have specialized seed capsules that open and disperse seeds after wildfires.
